creator: SNeelakantan_C@zaplet.com
text:
Hello,

This is what the Ant documentation recommends for moving a directory:
<snip>
Move a directory to a new directory

  <move todir="new/dir/to/move/to">
    <fileset dir="src/dir"/>
  </move>

</snip>
For a UNIX machine, 'mv'ing a directory doesn't copy all the files to the new 
directory... but the one above does ! Is there any other way, by which I can do 
it the UNIX way?

-Shankar

Created attachment 300
[PATCH][PARTIAL] Attempts rename before using copy/delete
creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com
umagesh@rediffmail.com
text:
While the patch I have submitted above below does not completely resolve this 
issue, I still think it is a step forward in the right direction.  

The above patch attempts to rename every file in the fileset using 
File.renameTo and if the attempt fails, the copy and delete method of moving is 
used.  This results in space/memory savings as well as significant improvement 
in performance.

Magesh

PS: This patch also contains resolution for 2515 though I have submitted that 
separately.

Created attachment 302
This patch improves upon the earlier patch by deleting the destination file if it exists before renaming to get workaround Java Bug.
